metadata.title: CVE-2017-15930 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In ReadOneJNGImage in coders/png.c in GraphicsMagick 1.3.26, a Null PointerDereference occurs while transferring JPEG scanlines, related to aPixelPacket pointer.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-15930` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

graphicsmagick - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm4
graphicsmagick-imagemagick-compat - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm4
libgraphics-magick-perl - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm4
libgraphicsmagick++3 - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm4
libgraphicsmagick3 - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm4
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: graphicsmagick package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm4').
